Air Purification: Cacti are known to purify the air by absorbing pollutants and releasing oxygen. They can be used in indoor spaces to improve air quality and create a healthier environment.

Landscape Design: Cacti can be incorporated into landscape design for their unique appearance and ability to thrive in arid environments. They can be used to create striking, low-maintenance gardens and outdoor spaces.

Furniture: Cacti can be used as a creative and sustainable material for furniture construction. They can be shaped into various forms, such as chairs, tables, and shelves, providing a unique and eco-friendly alternative to traditional furniture.

Textile Production: Cacti can be used to produce natural textiles, such as fibers and yarns, for clothing and textile production. These materials can be used to create sustainable and eco-friendly clothing lines.

Insulation: Cacti can be used as a natural insulation material in buildings, providing an energy-efficient alternative to traditional insulation methods. They can be harvested and processed into building materials that are both sustainable and cost-effective.
